sermons.title: (Christ) The Incomparable Christ
sermons.description: Brother Denny eloquently preaches on Christ and Who He is (2 Cor. 4:3-6 and John 1:1, 14). All through history His footprints can be traced. If we do not change, we have not seen Him. Oh to behold Him and gaze upon Him, it will bring change into our lives.

sermons.title: (Costa Rica) The Ministry of Refreshing Others
(Daniel: The Man God Uses #4) Fragrance of Christ
sermons.description: A man who chooses Christ and sees Christ in the Word is an aroma of Christ to God.  Daniel spends just ten minutes with the king but the fragrance of Christ lingered many years later.  All God has called you to do is to live before Him, and He will see to it that His fragrance permeates our family members and the lost world around us.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 15
sermons.description: Melchizedek teaches us that we don't always bless by giving big sermons; two or three appropriate sentences can be all it takes to stir up faith in someone else.  One revelation from God protected Abraham from the temptations from the king of Sodom.  Faith is hearing God's promise to you and "amening" that as Abraham did.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 5
sermons.description: Why does God allow temptation to come?  Behind the first temptation of the devil was this false grace to comfort people in their sin, whereas every word from God is a challenge to deliver from sin.  Satan still seeks to lead Christians away from simple devotion to Christ, which is simple obedience to what God has said.

sermons.title: (Genesis) 2 - The Light of the World
sermons.description: "Light be" is the first time God speaks in the biblical record, the significance which Johnson expounds upon.  The Apostle Paul had thought upon God's work in creation, to which that glorious light of revelation comes to us in the face of Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 19 - Children - a Dwelling Place for the Living God
sermons.description: Have you ever wondered how child training in spiritual disciplines (i.e., prayer, Bible reading, fasting, and so on) works when the child is not yet born again?  Brother Denny shares how parents who diligently apply themselves in training the body and soul of their children do them such a favor and give them a headstart when the Spirit of God does come to indwell them.

sermons.title: (Guidelines) Obey the Bible
sermons.description: One of the most obvious guidelines to the Bible…obey it! Obedience is essential to an understanding of the Bible. Examples from scripture, to show us how we have no right to expect God to talk to us if we do not have ‘obedience that comes from faith.’ Either the Bible will keep us from sin, or sin will keep us from the Bible.

sermons.title: (Happenings Ahead) Regenerated At The Judgement Seat
(Happenings Ahead) The Judgement Seat Of Christ
(Missions Conference Shoals) - Part 4
sermons.description: Can assurances for our salvation be found in the Word? Paul states a resounding YES! As he passionately takes the listener through the tests in 1 John, he challenges every believer to examine themselves in the light of God's Word.

sermons.title: (Remnant Meeting 2013) The Compelling Love of Jesus Christ
(Second Coming of Christ) 07 The Day Christians stand before Jesus
(The Better Covenant) 3 - A Life of Faith
sermons.description: "To walk by faith is as much superior to walking by sight as Jesus is higher than Moses," says brother Zac.  In the new covenant we have a better life of faith like Jesus, who overcame all sin and pleased the Father from morning until night.  The root causes of failure to walk by faith are in seeing faith as something in ourselves or working hard to obtain what only God can do.  Zac shares how he tried every doctrine of holiness and failed miserably until he came to see the simplicity of biblical faith--leaning of the human personality in total confidence in God's perfect love for me.

sermons.title: (The Mission and Ministry of the Holy Spirit) The Communion of the Holy Spirit
sermons.description: 2 Cor. 13:14 is the passage featured. Bro. Wilkerson carefully explains why the Holy Ghost was sent, and how to commune with him. It is much more simple than most think, yet much more vital to allow this communion, even hungrily seek it, than we realize. Jesus would not have asked the Father to send us a Comforter he knew we wouldn't need. We need to know why he was sent, why he dwells in us, and allow him to do what the Father sent him to do.

sermons.title: (The Real Jesus) 1 Jesus Did Not Seek His Own
sermons.description: This message by Poonen really will open your eyes to what type of Jesus you have been hearing and serving. You have to honestly ask yourself do you know the Real Jesus? Have you allowed Him to transform and change your life? This is going to be the Real Jesus and it is unfortunate that we have to speak about that because God never intended that there should ever be any other Jesus presented to this world than the real one. Everything valuable has been counterfeited, people don't counterfeit things that are not valuable. Even in the times of the apostles we read of Jesus being counterfeited. So I want to turn first of all to 2 Corinthians chapter 11 so you'll see that it is not a problem of the 21st century. It was there right from the beginning.

sermons.title: (The Real Jesus) 5 Jesus Overcame In Weakness
sermons.description: The secret of the Christian life is to be weak like Jesus, not seeking His own and trusting the Father.  Brother Zac shares a number of areas in our walk with the Lord, such as coming out from legalism and traditions not in the Bible, not leaning upon zealous believers so as to not develop an individual life with God, and taking caution not to be critical against others and subtly end up holding hands with the accuser of the brethren, the devil.

sermons.title: 01 Acknowledgements
sermons.description: Every New Testament Epistle is full of acknowledgments1 of believers who were in different cities and those who were laboring hard in the Lord. The names of those who have had a part in this volume are too numerous to mention. To all those who labored in editing, revising, suggesting and offering your counsel we are indebted. Above every human help we recognize the Lordâ€™s hand in this volume from the start to finish. The messages in this book were birthed out of a genuine burden2 of the Lord and we pray this burden has been conveyed with as little interference from the human vessels3 as possible.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 11 Principle 7 - The People of God Are the Church
sermons.description: Considering Church history and the moving of Godâ€™s Spirit in many groups that stood for the truth, a house Church or small gathering of believers is not so radical. Rather, gathering in this way is a preferred Biblical approach, especially when the Church is under persecution. If it was important to have specific church buildings to represent God and spread the Gospel, would God not have commanded them in Scripture? Although we find detailed instructions for the tabernacle in the Old Testament122 we find quite a different emphasis in the New Testament.123 We see this truth prophetically spoken by Stephen just before he was martyred: â€œHowever, the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says: â€˜Heaven is My throne, and the earth is My footstool. What kind of house will you build for Me? Says the Lord. Or where will My resting place be? Has not My hand made all these things?â€™ You stiff-necked people! Your hearts and ears are still uncircumcised. You are just like your ancestors: You always resist the Holy Spirit!â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 13 Principle 9 - The Early Apostles Didn't Seek After Money
sermons.description: Christianity is not about money, itâ€™s about people. Sadly modern Christendom has been overwhelmed with the salesman who sells Christ as ware and treats the holy things as a way to profit financially.150 It does not take much discernment for the worldly person to see the counterfeit preacher on TV who makes money look like their god.151 Yet, sadly, believers who are asleep spiritually, and have not been seeking the Lord, are given over to this delusion which is coming upon them in masses.152 False teachers abound and the saints are sleeping. There needs to be a clarion cry across all nations that God is not for sale and is against those who love money and equate righteousness with financial gain and profit.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 13. Did our first parents continue in the estate wherein they were created?
15. What was the sin whereby our first parents fell from the estate wherein they were created?
22 Principle 18 - The Satanic Counterfeit
sermons.description: Though God is always working in different ways and with different means, it is still only by the Spirit of God that the Church will grow. Over the past 50 years particularly originating in Western countries there have been such excesses and abuses of what is considered Spirit-filled Christianity that many true believers have been repulsed completely from even seeking the Lord for the true filling of the Spirit. This is not only a tragedy but one of Satanâ€™s tactics323 to hinder the growth of the true Church of Jesus Christ. The genuine believer should never feel scared to call out to God for fresh infusions of the Spirit of God for service324 and to foster a dependence on the Holy Spirit of God daily in his life.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 26 Principle 22 - God Uses the Weak By His Spirit
sermons.description: God does not look to find those who are the elites and those who are the most skilled. Rather He looks for the weak383 and foolish who trust in Him. God uses broken pots and vessels,384 He uses imperfect people who trust in a perfect God. Thus all men will know that it is God who has manifested His power and glory through a brother or sister. It is realized then that it was not the work of men385 but the work of God. To bring maximum glory to His Name the Lord is assembling an end times movement of weak, poor, helpless, and despised people who the religious system of our day have written off as unusable for their purposes.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 28 Principle 24 - Christ the Unity of the Body
sermons.description: Denominations, being splintered by slight shades of truth, are not pleasing to God, but rather grieve Him, though like a precious diamond we can see something good in every denomination.404 There is always some truth that one specific denomination knows, believes and preaches that is noteworthy and admirable for us to learn from. Yet overall it is not Godâ€™s perfect will for His body to be divided.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 39 Principle 35 - The Lord Supper The Death of Christ
sermons.description: The Lordâ€™s Supper is clearly a New Testament practice that the early disciples kept, as its significance is tied into the end of the age. The Scripture says that as we remember the Lord we are proclaiming His death until He comes back.555 This death is important because by the death of Christ, He took upon Himself our sins and absolved the wrath of God on our behalf.556 What a glorious Good News to celebrate that this is a finished work557 and we do not have to suffer the wrath of God for our sins if we are in Jesus Christ and walking in a life of true discipleship with Him.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 40 Principle 36 - Dependence on the Moving of the Holy Spirit
sermons.description: In The Book of Acts the Church was birthed, led, sustained and grew in the power of the Holy Spirit. For many there is a hesitancy to speak much of depending radically on the moving of the Holy Spirit. Today for many sincere Bible believing Christians this terminology brings to mind many excesses of the worst kindâ€”whether itâ€™s the selfish seeking after the Spirit of God for a feeling,569 an anointing to enjoy for ourselves,570 some sort of extravagant healing such as gold in the teeth or other blatant extra-biblical manifestations that grieve the heart of God. The Devil our enemy always makes a pseudo571 of the genuine in attempts to deceive572 some and deter others. Some in these charismatic circles claim the Chinese Church is experiencing the same manifestations, but this is not true.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 6. How many persons are there in the Godhead?
A Concern for Holiness and Its Cost
sermons.description: Ernest C. Reisinger shares he heart plainly on this subject of holiness at a conference where J.I. Packer was a speaker. He quotes Ravenhill part way through the sermon stating he "wished someone would simply just read the bible and believe it." And he didn't finish the statement "and put us all to shame." This is a great theological talk over the subject of holiness and will cater to more holiness in your life personally.

sermons.title: A New Creation
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson attempts to clarify the misunderstanding of the role of the Law of Moses in the plan of God, and how it is to apply to Christians today. He discusses the dynamics involved in moving The Law from the stone tablets to the Christian heart, so that we love and obey God by nature – which is the definition of the new covenant, according to Hebrews 8:10. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A New Creature
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson discusses the aspect of God’s Plan that includes the new outer man and the new inner man. He discusses the differences between, and reasons for, imputed righteousness and actual righteousness. He discusses what grace is for, and what grace is not for, while clearly defining what the new covenant is, including practical application for our lives today. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A Paradox
sermons.description: The expression is paradoxical, and seems somewhat singular; yet it was the experience of the apostle Paul, a man of calm spirit, by no means fanciful, a wise man, and far removed from a fanatic. It was the experience of one who was led of the Spirit of God, and therefore it was a gracious experience: the experience of one who was a father in Israel, who could safely bid us to be imitators of him, even as he imitated the Lord Jesus Christ; and therefore it was a safe experience. If we are weak, so was Paul; and if, like him, we are strong in our weakness, we shall be in the best of company. If the same things be seen in us which were wrought in the apostle of the Gentiles, we may join with him in glorying in infirmities, because the power of Christ doth rest upon us, and we may count ourselves happy that with such a saint we can cry, “When I am weak, then am I strong.” I. Perhaps I can expound the text best if I first TURN IT THE OTHER WAY UP, and use it as a warning. When I am strong, then am I weak. Perhaps, while thinking of the text thus turned inside out, we shall be getting light upon it to be used when we view it with the right side outwards, and see that when we are weak, then we are strong. I am quite sure that some people think themselves very strong, and are not so...

sermons.title: A Sermon That Has Angered Many - Examine Yourself
sermons.description: This sermon is a bible test of whether you are in the faith or not.  He goes line by line in the text of 1 john that explains how you can tell if you are in the faith. I would suggest that every believer listen to this sermon. It is very encouraging to the believer to not be deceived.

sermons.title: A Target of Satan's Envy
sermons.description: February 4, 2007 - This is a word for those who are going through difficult times, mentally, spiritually or physically. If you have decided to cross the line of luke warmness and you are fully surrendered to the Lord's purposes you will become a target for satan. Nothing shakes the kingdom of hell more than a prayng Christian who is sold out for Jesus. When satan recognizes this fire in us he will attempt to torment our minds with evil thoughts of past failures and sin. His plan is to neutralize our spiritual fight. God is calling us to get our focus off our afflictions and sin and go back to the New Covenant and declare Jesus to be the Highest Authority than anything the devil can throw at us.

sermons.title: A Word For Those Who Feel Like Quitting
sermons.description: October 3, 2010 - You might say you started your walk with the Lord with such optimism and all of a sudden you are fighting wars within and wars without. You know the battle is fierce and in and of yourself you have no power to get through your situation. The enemy will roar in your ear with the lie that your circumstance is greater than your God. This message encourages us that if Christ is in us we will never be overpowered by the voice or strategy of the devil. God will take you through before He takes you out. He will give you supernatural strength and your testimony will be Jesus took me through. Never give up because God is on your side!

sermons.title: ALREADY HEAVEN
sermons.description: God’s kingdom is the kingdom of heaven, which, as Jesus said, is already in our midst today. Therefore, the kingdom of heaven should be a joyful reality in our lives. But what does this mean in practical terms? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: According To My Righteousness
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson discusses the monumental lie that pervades current Christian churches that the purpose of Grace is to serve as an alternative to living righteously. Grace is being presented, he says, as an excuse to live however we want, yet still receive eternal life and blessing from God. He asserts that, as Psalm 18 says, God will reward us according to our righteousness. Rather than grace being an excuse for unrighteous behavior, it is the very power and ability to live righteously.

sermons.title: Another Gospel
sermons.description: David Wilkerson gives a strong message with "prophetic urgency." He clearly shows that the "prosperity gospel" teaching that gain is godliness is unscriptural and a lie from hell. Surely this is a word from God to a generation of Christians in America that have swallowed this ear tickling teaching up to their demise.

sermons.title: Another Jesus
sermons.description: Pastor Conlon goes through many other scriptures in this stirring message about the Jesus of the Bible, and man's preconceived notion of Jesus, based on men's theology and doctrines. The primary concern of the LOrd is that he get hold of your life and form himself in you, even if it means you might suffer because of what he's doing in your life. He wants the fruit of Christ manifested in you, that others will be brought out of darkness into the light. That your life be used for his glory and that you take up your cross and follow him daily. Not sure what your cross is? This message helps you understand.

sermons.title: Another Jesus, Another Spirit, Another Gospel
Awake And Be Ready
sermons.description: Stephen talks about the need for us to be awake, to repent, and to return to Christ.

sermons.title: BE RECONCILED
sermons.description: God longs to live and work in our hearts so that we may be reconciled with Him and each other. This meditation shares what happened when somebody dared to take the first step of reconciliation and let go of grudges. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Be a Man (At Home and At Church)
sermons.description: All men, even Christians, are so influenced by the culture we live in, that we say and do many things that are not Biblical, without even realising it. Paul Washer begins his exhortations by dealing with the speculations (AV = ‘imaginations’) which must be cast down if we are to fulfil our calling to be a biblical people. He focuses on the roles of men in particular, both in their families and their local churches, which he shows to be the two hardest places to live out a Biblical manhood. Most problems in those two areas, he says, can be traced back to men not standing on truth and not acting Biblically. Working through specific examples, he shows how the speculations of men actually fight against God, and also shows how such things should be put right. He then focuses in some detail on marriage, using Romans 8:28. Once a man discovers the true purpose of marriage, and learns what it means to love his wife as Christ loves the church, he will find both joy and rest in putting an end to his former speculations about the nature of marriage.  (52 minutes)

sermons.title: Bearing a True Witness of God
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson makes the case that the New Covenant is primarily a covenant of transformation, rather than the popular opinion that it is primarily a covenant of forgiveness. He discusses the differences and similarities between the old and new covenants. He discusses the difference between preaching and witnessing. He talks about how Jesus doesn’t judge us based upon what we believe, but rather based upon what we do and how we live each day. We witness by what we are and how we live, not by what we say. The second half of this sermon is very strong. (53 minutes 54 seconds)

sermons.title: Biblical Assurance (Part 1)
sermons.description: After introductory comments to the local assembly, Paul Washer begins this series of messages with the Apostle’s exhortation, “Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith”. How can you be truly assured that you have believed unto salvation? he asks. How do you know you are saved? The only way, is to examine your life in the light of what the Bible reveals about genuine faith, he asserts; and the best place to get a Biblical assurance instead of an emotional one is 1st John. (54 minutes)

sermons.title: Biblical Assurance 1 - Austin, TX
sermons.description: A foundational series of 5 messages on assurance. Very good teaching on this imortant doctrine.

sermons.title: Blessed is He Who Knoweth His Limitations
Cherishing the Treasure of Christ
sermons.description: We have this treasure in earthen vessels; the Spirit of the living God indwelling believers. And that presence will produce in a hungry soul an ever increasing revelation of who Christ is. This is often revealed in us and to us through suffering and trials. We have this great kingdom which cannot be moved, such great victory, and power living in us. Pastor Conlon goes through many other scriptures revealing how the Lord Jesus Christ is our Treasure. The person drawing closer to Him, cannot help being awed by Him, and at the same time painfully aware of their own sinful flesh in comparison. If your heart is toward Christ he knows, and he will not let the enemy overwhelm you as you trust in him. Pursuit of an ever increasing knowledge and intimacy with Christ should be the Christian's number one priority. When we get careless with the word of God and prayer, tragedy can come. The devil is always after the treasure of the presence of Christ in your life. Pastor Conlon warns: There is no greater danger than to become careless with this Book!

sermons.title: Desert Survival Series Pt 27- Moses The Servant of God
Don't Break God's Heart
sermons.description: What a tradegy that many of God's people are missing their birthright, inheritance and what Christ secured on us for the cross. Forgiveness of sins is just like cleaning the cup but there is much more purpose and fulness in God that we need to seek after. Is the Devil robbing our inheritance in Christ? This breaks God's heart in our day.

sermons.title: Don't Give Up
sermons.description: Sometimes we grow fearful and sometimes we become fatigued. God will give you strength day by day as you call on him and trust in him. He will refresh you today.

sermons.title: Eight Ways Of Deceiving Ourselves
sermons.description: It is important to remember that the first sin in the human race came through deception and that Satan today is the deceiver of the whole world.  Zac Poonen shares on eight areas we are prone to being deceived and how to protect ourselves.  "It is only God's mercy," he exhorts, "that can save us from deception."

sermons.title: Enlarging Our Hearts
sermons.description: Zac Poonen speaks on the problem in the corinthian church and many believers today of having a narrow heart, that is the reason they were fleshy, babes and never grew spiritually. But Paul the apostle exhorts the believers to "enlarge" their hearts and not have a narrow hearts. There are 2 things that make a persons heart narrow or large: Faith and Love.

sermons.title: Finishing the Course - 03 The Ministry of the Holy Spirit
Finishing the Course - 08 Being a nobody
For the Love of Christ Constraineth Us
sermons.description: Glyn Owen beautifully and forcefully brings the text upon us 'For the Love of Christ Constraineth Us.' There is something not just in the words of this sermon but the spirit behind it that makes it effectual to the mind that hears it. Do we understand something of the experience of Paul the Apostle in this text? Are you constrained, compelled by God? Are you serving yourself or are you dead to yourself and serving the Living God?

sermons.title: Forever Dwelling in the Presence of God
sermons.description: God has a desire to dwell in the midst of his people and he wants us to desire to dwell in his presence as well. We can only faithfully represent him when we truly know him. If you are not actively, honestly seeking God, then you need to get down to business and ask him for the desire and hunger in your heart for him. He will give it to those who are sincere. And they will reap wonderful rewards of joy and peace in their God. We need to actively seek God, wanting his ways and thoughts over our own to become so intimate with him that we know his heart and share it. Then we will love what he loves and hate what he hates. Thinking as he things, walking together in agreement. This is what God wants with each of his children. For those who want a closer walk with the Lord, this is a must hear.

sermons.title: Freedom From This World System
sermons.description: There is a distinction between “loving the world” and not being “of the world,” that believers must make.  We are not called to hide from the world, but rather we are to be in it while being completely freed from its clutches, and free from its systemic tyranny over our lives.  This sermon shows how, if you use worldly methods to attract people to your fellowships, worldly people are all you will attract.  Brother Zac uses a flurry of scriptures to blow away any notion that it is acceptable to God to still be of this present evil world.

sermons.title: GWH-Ladies Missionary Seminar-1985 Verses To Cope With Crises
Genuine Conversion
sermons.description: The name of God is blasphemed among unbelievers because of the ungodly lives of those who claim to be believers but are not. Given the Apostle Paul’s command to believers to test themselves, Mr Washer uses Biblical truth to destroy the concept of the ‘Carnal Christian’ and to expose the wickedness of modern evangelical methods. Men are not saved by repeating a prayer, he says; they are saved by repenting of their sin and believing the Gospel. (41 minutes)

sermons.title: Gideon #3: The Manifestation of The Lord Jesus Christ
sermons.description: What does it mean to release the life of God for others?  Gideon's 300 provides vital clues of what makes up God's remnant, the New Testament overcomer.  We are the vessels God uses, but He must break us in order for His glory to shine out of us.

sermons.title: Glory of God in Dry Places
sermons.description: This message is wonderful for those who are discouraged in their walk with Jesus. God wants to fill us with Himself so that we never run dry - even if our present circumstances seem overwhelming, He is faithful.

sermons.title: God Omnipotent Reigns In Our Lives
sermons.description: This message was preached at the 1981 General Council of the Assemblies of God. Wilkerson gives a overview of the ministry God has given him to serve New York City and speaks of the wickedness growing in America. He speaks of the growing homosexual movement in America. He speaks of the grace of God and that God can forgive anyone who repents and comes to Christ.

sermons.title: Grace: Invaluable or In Vain
sermons.description: Far too many Christians are oblivious to the inestimable value of Godâ€™s amazing grace that is available to them in Christ.  Thus they are ignoring their most valuable resource, which means that for them, at least in their daily lives, Godâ€™s grace has been in vain.  How tragic!  Yet it doesnâ€™t have to be that way.  Donâ€™t let Godâ€™s grace go to waste.

sermons.title: Growing in the Grace of God #13 - Characters of New Covenant Life & Service Part 1
Growing in the Grace of God #14 - Characters of New Covenant Life & Service Part 2
Growing in the Grace of God #15 - Contrasts Between the Old & New Covenant Part 1
Growing in the Grace of God #16 - Contrasts Between the Old & New Covenant Part 2
Growing in the Grace of God #17 - More Characteristics of New Covenant Living Part 1
Growing in the Grace of God #18 - More Characteristics of New Covenant Living Part 2
Guide Posts and Warning Signs
sermons.description: You will be blessed listening as Paul Washer shares from what he calls his "life verses". This is a rich sermon full of truth that can be summed up with the message that knowledge of Christ is more important than anything.

sermons.title: HOW TO PRAY IN TIMES OF DEPRESSION
sermons.description: God lives and works today!  But perhaps you don’t feel that way because you’re depressed about your sins.  Maybe you feel so hopeless that you can’t even pray!  If so, then this meditation can help you.

sermons.title: HOW TO PRAY IN TIMES OF DEPRESSION
sermons.description: God lives and works today! But perhaps you don't feel that way because you're depressed about your sins. Maybe you feel so hopeless that you can't even pray! If so, then today's meditation, by Basilea Schlink, can help you.

sermons.title: Have You Turned From A Life of Sin?
Helpers In Prayer
sermons.description: Prayer can often become one of the most selfish things we do. In the light of scriptures, this messages examines the prayer life, and what it is to be. Communion with the Lord leads to spiritual growth, but intercession for the lost is often neglected. We need a burden for the lost and dying world around us.

sermons.title: High Doctrine
sermons.description: I WOULD have you look on this text as being a summary of all the things which we have preached to you these years. It has been my endeavor, constantly and continually, to maintain that salvation is of God's good will, and not of man's free will; that man is nothing, and that Jesus Christ is both Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last. And I think I may truly say, “Now of the things which we have spoken, this is the sum” — “all things are of God.” And oh my brethren, what a large summary it is! it contains words which grasp the compass of everything that your mind can think upon — “all things;” and it proclaims him to whom all things owe their being — “God.” Grasp this total if you are able, “All things!” What is here omitted? Surely whatsoever the Christian can desire is to be found in those words “All things.” But lest even that should not be comprehensive enough, our summary contains a still greater word, one which is supreme over all inasmuch as all things spring from his loins, and yet he remaineth still the same, as full as ever. “All things are of God.” If we be thirsty, here are streams that never can be exhausted. If we be hungry, surely here is bread enough and to spare.

sermons.title: How Much Are You Worth
sermons.description: In any man be in  Christ, he is a new creature. This is a fact—a statement of fact. You will understand what it really means to be “In Christ”.  The characteristics of man in Adam and man in Christ are compared.  You will have to decide which “man” you are.

sermons.title: How To Develop Your Life's Message
Interceding for others
sermons.description: Manley Beasley preached this sermon in the 1980's about the Christian's responsibility that today is the day of salvation.  He shared how God dealt with his heart that he had received the grace of God as a gift through the Father, Son and Holy Spirit as well as the saints who have gone before.  He pleads with the church to wake up and stop playing church games, for souls are in the balance for their day of salvation.

sermons.title: Into The All Sufficiency Of Christ #1 - Emptied
sermons.description: "God had to take Paul beyond Paul into the all sufficiency of Jesus," says Ed Miller.  He draws out practical truths from 2 Corinthians, the heartbeat of Paul, one whom God set forth as the "only model of the complete Christian life."  When God takes us beyond our limits, it's to know Him and be occupied with Himself.

sermons.title: Into The All Sufficiency Of Christ #2 - Fulness
sermons.description: Ed Miller shows how the Apostle Paul's whole view of Christian service and victory changed when he "stepped over the line" into the all sufficiency of Christ.  Paul could have victory 100% of the time, because victory was not a gift to possess but something wrapped up in a Person, Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: Into The All Sufficiency Of Christ #3 - Brokenness
sermons.description: "In order for Christ to be manifested," teaches Ed Miller, "the clay pot has to be broken."  Four simple principles from the life of Paul makes us not brokenness-centered but Christ-centered.  Brother Ed how Paul could endure the sufferings because he was "never at home" but enjoying the presence of the Lord.

sermons.title: Into The All Sufficiency Of Christ #4 - Ministry
sermons.description: Ed Miller concludes this 4-part series by showing that there can be no ministry that does not flow out of heart poverty.  "In real ministry, only God is the giver and only the Lord Jesus is the gift.  If all they've touched you, they've touched death."  Miller draws out that powerful principle for all Christian service, illustrating that from the Macedonians "who gave Christ and wrapped it with their money."

sermons.title: Is Your Work Being Tried by Fire?
sermons.description: October 22, 2006. If we are willing to build on the true foundation of Jesus Christ there is a reward of a hidden wisdom of knowledge and instruction. Jesus will come and burn in us with a fiery jealousy; He will consume everything that is not like Him. This fire is an inner passion born of the life of Christ within us. It’s a fire that is always gathering and burning that which does not conform to the image of Christ within us. Jesus will try our works everyday by fire constantly changing and challenging and taking those things that are unlike Him and burning them in the fire of His passionate love for us.

sermons.title: LET LOVE BE VICTORIOUS
sermons.description: God is at work building His kingdom.  We can take part in this by doing one simple thing - by letting love be victorious!  This meditation will give us some helpful tips about how to do it.

sermons.title: LET LOVE BE VICTORIOUS
sermons.description: God is at work building His kingdom. We can take part in this by letting love be victorious! The following meditation will give us some helpful tips about how to do it.

sermons.title: Living With Your Passion
sermons.description: Three Commitments Jesus Christ asks us to make. Purity in Marriage, Purity in our thoughts, Purity in our associations. September 1984 - Flames of Freedom Family Rally.

sermons.title: Logos in Language
sermons.description: In this message, Dr. Smith explains how all of nature contains language.  Animals, plants, humans, every living thing has what he acutely titles, “psycho-space.”  The psycho space being the realm in which each living thing has the capacity for some degree of thought or communication.  He proceeds to explain that the logos of God is communicated fundamentally to man through his character.  We see the logos of God in how Jesus healed Malcus’s ear, and how he endured such contradiction from rebel’s and sinners.  It is within our psycho-space that we must fill our “minds” with this mind of Christ, which is full of love, joy, peace, patience, and the fruit of the Spirit, as we follow the Spirit, the logos of God step-wise begins to conform us into the likeness of the logos of Christ.  Smith also shares a great testimony how an SS Nazi officer was converted to the faith when he shared with him about the strength of Christ character.

sermons.title: Making The Testimony Of Jesus Our Testimony
sermons.description: Stephen shares about how our testimony is different from the testimony of Jesus and the one thing that must be done if the testimony of Jesus is to become our testimony.

sermons.title: Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Helps You Live by Faith
Men Whose Eyes Have Seen The King - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1959.

sermons.title: New Covenant Greater Then The Old Covenant
sermons.description: God desires to show Himself holy "through us".  May we come to the full knowledge of how He has provided everything we need that this be accomplished through the full knowledge of Him.  May there not be found in any of us an evil unbelieving heart regarding the promises of overcoming sin, and putting to death everything pertaining to our old man.  As we drive out the enemies of our souls, (those evil desires that war against us) and put them to death by the power of the Holy Spirit, may the King of Rightteousness shine forth through His bondservants who He translated out of the kingdom of darkness and into His glorious light.

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 3
sermons.description: In this message, Paul confronts the listener with many of the false doctrines found in American Christianity today. By taking us through the tests in 1 John, he helps us examine our choices and lifestyle. Do we look and act like the world around us or are we striving against the current to follow our King?

sermons.title: Our Ambition is to Please Him
sermons.description: Every person has passion. Even the man sitting in an easy chair has an ambition to not be ambitious. We're so busy with so many pursuits that we shouldn't follow. Some of those ambitions will destroy us if they aren't right ambitions. For what ambition were you intended to be swallowed up by life for? What awaits you?

sermons.title: Prayer And Revival - Part 1
sermons.description: Pastor McLeod shares many passages of scripture and examples from his own experience of revival and some from the experience of others, emphasizing the importance of prayer, especially in the preparation of the work of God in the midst of His people. After a summary of testimonials that led up to the revival in Saskatoon, Bill touches upon several vital aspects that prayer has in effecting revival, which he defines as "Christians coming up to a New Testament level."  "Prayer," he says, "is the first thing and only thing."

sermons.title: Reigning in Life - Part 1
sermons.description: "If you're currently receiving the abundance of grace," says Alan Martin, "you're abounding in life."  Because all of the grace of God is in Christ, when you have Him, you have it all!  Our great need then is to grow through the ministry of the Holy Spirit in the awareness of what God has already given us in Christ.

sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality - Listening to the Spirit
sermons.description: "The Christian life," says Zac Poonen, "is not following a code of conduct; it's following a Person."  Brother Zac explains many failures in the Christian life that come by "doing something for the Lord" without waiting upon Him and obeying the little promptings of the Holy Spirit.  "When you listen to God and do what He says, you can do more in six months than in sixty years of trying to do something on your own."

sermons.title: Revelation of Jesus Christ - Part 8 of 10
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1958.

sermons.title: Role Of Spiritual Warfare As Preparation For A Spiritual Awakening
SUFFERING TURNS TO GLORY
sermons.description: With God, suffering is never the end. This is an exciting truth of Christian discipleship. But what does it really mean, and how can we apply it to our lives?

sermons.title: SUFFERING TURNS TO GLORY
sermons.description: With God, suffering is never the end. This is an exciting truth of Christian discipleship. But what does it really mean, and how can we apply it to our lives? The answer is in this meditation!

sermons.title: Satan's Final War Plan Exposed
sermons.description: There is great attack against those on the "front lines" in ministry. The devil is aiming all of his amunition toward those who "love God and are the called according to His purpose." This is a message about the war with the principalities, a war that true Christian’s fight each and every day.  This spiritual war was declared in the Garden of Eden but in these last days Satan is changing his plans.  Time is near and Satan knows that his time is short.  Since the cross, Satan has approached this spiritual warfare in a different way for those that are covered by the blood of Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: Seeing and Savoring Jesus Christ for the Sake of Making Him Known
sermons.description: John Piper affectionately addresses his congregation to be evangelists and the right spirit in doing so.  The right kind of evangelism flows from seeing and savoring Jesus Christ not from private revelation but the revelation of the Holy Spirit of Christ in the Bible.  When we are directed back to the portrait of Christ, it is the key to all evangelism and our transformation.

sermons.title: Seeking God With All Our Heart
sermons.description: Brother Zac Poonen shares about seeking God and how many things can hinder finding fellowship with the Lord. He shares on the sabbath rest and how God prescribed a rest so that God could be put first. In the same way in the New Covenant we are to give our first to the Lord amidst the distractions and allures of this world. One chief underlying factor of not seeking the Lord is greed for money and covetousness of which the children of Israel fell into time and time again instead of seeking the Lord first.

sermons.title: Seven Wonderful Promises
sermons.description: "We have a tendency toward old covenant blessings and never come into the new covenant," says brother Zac.  Seven wonderful promises--deliverance from sins, fullness of the Spirit, bearable tests, sufficient grace, and others--are by faith in the One--Jesus Christ--in whom every promise is Yes when we give our Amen.

sermons.title: Stop Worshipping And Idolizing Celebrity Preachers
THE WAY TO VICTORY
sermons.description: Perhaps you feel discouraged at the moment. Do the same problems keep cropping up, the same sins even though you’ve given your life to Jesus Christ?

sermons.title: THE WAY TO VICTORY
sermons.description: God lives and works today! But perhaps you don’t feel that way at the moment. Do the same problems keep cropping up, the same sins even though you’ve given your life to Jesus Christ? This meditation will encourage you!

sermons.title: TURN-ABOUT
sermons.description: God lives and works today! Why do these words bring so little joy to most of our lives? Could it be that our lives have taken paths that aren’t in accordance with God’s will - paths that lead us further away from Him? This meditation called, TURN-ABOUT is a practical help for all those of us who would like to find our way back to God. sermons.title: Tear Down the Strongholds
sermons.description: This message discusses satanic strongholds and the place they have in our lives. The bondages of fear and curses are also addressed.

sermons.title: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift
That Which Is Born Of Flesh
That Which Is Of The Flesh
The Book of 2 Corinthians
sermons.description: Often called "the hard letter", this is an intensely personal letter. It recounts the difficulties and hardships Paul has endured in the service of Christ (10-13). The Apostle regards the Corinthians as his children in Christ.

sermons.title: The Call Of God - A Loving Father In Heaven
sermons.description: "One of the byproducts of knowing God as Father was it delivered me from competition with other believers," speaks brother Zac.  Knowing God as Father is one of his favorite subjects, never tiring to share how much liberty comes in the Christian life, assurance that truly all things work together for good, and the deliverance from counterfeit holiness that comes from the fear of man.

sermons.title: The Cost of Not Following Christ
The Cross of Christ (Providence Chapel in Denton, TX)
The Divine Anointing - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 01/01/1958.

sermons.title: The Glory Of God
sermons.description: Don Courville shares about Apostle Paul's thorn in the flesh. Is Christ all you need? Everything to the Glory of God. This is a great radio devotional bringing biblical balance to this very important subject.

sermons.title: The Glory of the New Covenant
The Gospel Of The Devil! Believe It Not (2)
The Gospel of Accommodation
sermons.description: Accommodate means to adapt, to make suitable and acceptable, to make convenient. A gospel of accommodation is creeping into the United States. It's an American cultural invention to appease the lifestyle of luxury and pleasure. Primarily a Caucasian, suburban gospel, it's also in our major cities and is sweeping the nation, influencing ministers of every denomination, and giving birth to megachurches with thousands who come to hear a nonconfronting message.

sermons.title: The Horizon of Christ - Part 7
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1961.

sermons.title: The Judgement Seat of Christ
sermons.description: What does Judgment mean for a Christian?    Pastor Lutzer expounds the Judgments’ of Christ. Lutzer goes on and preaches that a Christian will be judged fairly, individually and thoroughly. This is a much neglected topic in preaching in our generation.

sermons.title: The Judgement Seat of Christ, Does It Matter?
The Lost Gospel by Paul Washer
The Mightiest Weapon God can have at His Disposal
The Ministry Of The Church - Part 2

sermons.title: The Ministry of Beholding His Face
The Occult
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod covers the subject of the occult showing what things are hidden and beyond the bounds of normal human knowledge. Such occult is demonic and opposed to the counsel and spirit of God. We are to have no fellowship with the hidden things of darkness but rather reprove and uncover these things.

sermons.title: The Occult by Bill Mcleod
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod covers the subject of the occult showing what things are hidden and beyond the bounds of normal human knowledge. Such occult is demonic and opposed to the counsel and spirit of God. We are to have no fellowship with the hidden things of darkness but rather reprove and uncover these things.

sermons.title: The Power of Travailing Prayer by Mark Greening
sermons.description: This message delivered by Mark Greening is a powerful exhortation to true prayer and intercession that brings revival. With testimonies of God working just months before and examples of church history of such praying. With many scriptures given to substantiate this type of praying we are helpless but to say we have not such a conception of praying in our day. Oh may we humble ourselves and let our Master teach us afresh what it means to "travail."

sermons.title: The Power of Travailing Prayer by Mark Greening
sermons.description: This message delivered by Mark Greening is a powerful exhortation to true prayer and intercession that brings revival. With testimonies of God working just months before and examples of church history of such praying. With many scriptures given to substantiate this type of praying we are helpless but to say we have not such a conception of praying in our day. Oh may we humble ourselves and let our Master teach us afresh what it means to "travail."

sermons.title: The Return Of God's Glory
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod shares about times in scripture when the glory of God departs. This is a very sobering message that has the anointing of God's Spirit on it. It is very clear that the message is spoken as the oracles of God. Some of the testimonies that are shared at the end of true revival are very God glorifying. Oh that God might send a revival again.

sermons.title: The Return Of God's Glory by Bill Mcleod
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod shares about times in scripture when the glory of God departs. This is a very sobering message that has the anointing of God's Spirit on it. It is very clear that the message is spoken as the oracles of God. Some of the testimonies that are shared at the end of true revival are very God glorifying. Oh that God might send a revival again.

sermons.title: The Spiritual Battle and Love of God
The Sufficiency Of God For Holy Living
sermons.description: Jeff Christianson shares that the desire of God is for His Church to walk in holy living before Him. He explains that this power is not of ourselves but of God and by the operation of God's Holy Spirit. Will you let Christ in you change your living today to do His will?

sermons.title: The Way To Look At Things
sermons.description: Are you discouraged? Are you about to give up? Pastor Cymbala examines how Paul handled adversity. We trust you will find this message encouraging as it points to God's faithfulness. He looks at the passage of 2 Corinthians where it says that outward circumstances seem to be against us but internally we have an eternal destination so we should set our hearts there with that hope.

sermons.title: UNREMOVABLE TRACES
sermons.description: Most people spend a great deal of time on their appearance. However, few take the right precautions so that they will continue to be attractive – even when they get old. This meditation will share what these right precautions are.

sermons.title: UNREMOVABLE TRACES
sermons.description: God lives and works today! Most people spend a great deal of time on their appearance – trying to make themselves look attractive. However, few take the right precautions so that they will continue to be attractive –  even when they get old. This meditation will share with us what these right precautions are

sermons.title: WHEN YOU DON’T FEEL WELL
sermons.description: God lives and works today! But perhaps it is hard for you to believe this because you are sick, wondering why God would let you suffer this way? Or perhaps you feel so run down and tired that you don't know what to do or think? If either of these is the case, the following message may have just the help you've been looking for!

sermons.title: What Is the Recession For?
sermons.description: This is a message about God’s purposes in the recession. By recession I don’t have any sophisticated definition in mind. I just mean various financial setbacks like business slowdown, decreasing profits, massive layoffs and joblessness, the bursting of the housing bubble, thousands of foreclosures, personal and business bankruptcies, bank failures, investment company collapses, the loss of retirement funds, and the social ills and unrest that go with the downturn. God is sovereign over these things, he foresees them all, he causes or permits them all, and when he causes or permits something, he does so with purpose and design.

sermons.title: When Prophets Return to the Gate
Without spot or wrinkle
sermons.description: There is the way of the world and God's way of holiness. The world gets engaged with a party, drinking and boozing, but we as Christians do it in God's house with prayer and in holiness. Some say that there are many ways to celebrate an engagement. Yes, there certainly are many ways to hell but only one way to heaven. The ring the young man gives to his future bride is a token and promise that he will keep himself pure for her until the day of marriage; in receiving the ring, the girl makes the same promise. Young people should live like Mary the mother of Jesus. When the angel told her that she would bare a son, she replied, “How can this be, since I do not know a man?” (Luke 1:34) She lived a holy and pure life as we read in 1Cor 7:34, “The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit.”
